revised_title: Stokes Phenomenon and High-Order Phase-Integral Approximations
tldr: The author studies the behavior of waves near Stokes lines, which are loci of greatest disparity between dominant and subdominant phase-integral approximate solutions in wave physics. The author focuses on the large-k asymptotics and the optimal choice of asymptotic representation for the subdominant multiplier, which takes a simple form as a universal function of a natural variable describing the crossing of the line. This result is obtained without resumming divergent series, and it applies to various fields, including diffraction integrals and catastrophe optics.
